# First Colonial High School

| url                     =
| district                = Virginia Beach City Public Schools
| superintendent          = Donald E. Robertson
| principal               = Daniel Miani
| fundingtype             = Public
| schooltype              = high school
| grades                  = 9-12
| communities             = Croatan Beach, Kings Grant, Shadowlawn, Alanton, Baycliff
| nickname                = Patriots
| colors                  = Columbia blue and gold
| founded                 = 1966
| enrollment              = 1,732 (2023-24)
| ratio                   = 17.05
| staff                   = 101.59 (FTE)
| rival                   = Cox High School
| conference              = Virginia High School LeagueBeach DistrictEastern Region
| footnotes               =
}}
First Colonial High School is a high school in Virginia Beach, Virginia.  It is a part of the Virginia Beach City Public Schools, serving 1,732 students (2023–24).
Demographics
The demographic breakdown of the 2,039 students enrolled in 2013-14 was:
*Male - 48.7%
*Female - 51.3%
*Native American/Alaskan - 0.3%
*Asian/Pacific islanders - 2.5%
*Black - 17.4%
*Hispanic - 9.0%
*White - 64.5%
*Multiracial - 6.3%
26.5% of the students were eligible for free or reduced lunch.
Legal Studies Academy
Virginia Beach City Public Schools is known for its academy system. First Colonial High School hosts the Legal Studies Academy, which provides students who have an interest in and curiosity about the law, law-related fields, and legal and ethical issues the opportunity to extend their knowledge beyond the typical high school program.[https://firstcolonialhs.vbschools.com/legalstudies First Colonial Legal Studies Academy]
Athletics
First Colonial offers many sports, including:
*Baseball
**State champs - 1993, 2024.
*Basketball
*Competition Cheer
*Sideline Cheer
*Cross Country
*Field hockey
•Lacrosse
**State champs - 2011, 2012 & 2015.
*Football
*Gymnastics
*Indoor Track
*Soccer
**Girls state champs - 2018, 2021
**Boys state champs - 2021
*Softball
*Swimming
**Girls state champs 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023
*Tennis
**Girls state champs - 1977, 1982, 2011
*Track
*Volleyball
**Boys state champs - 1997
**Girls state champs - 2000, 2002, 2014, 2023
*Wrestling

*Wade Barrett - soccer player
*Josh Boone - filmmaker
*Derrick Borte - filmmaker

*Raven Greene - football player
*Skylar Johnston - softball player

*Mark Reynolds - baseball player
